solution_line_template: After one year he earns $200 in interest because {initial_deposit} x {first_year_interest_rate} = <<{initial_deposit}*{first_year_interest_rate}={first_year_interest_earned}>>{first_year_interest_earned}
After one year it has $1,200 in the account because {initial_deposit} + {first_year_interest_earned} = <<{initial_deposit}+{first_year_interest_earned}={balance_after_year1}>>{balance_after_year1}
After this it has $600 in it because {balance_after_year1} - {amount_withdrawn} = <<{balance_after_year1}-{amount_withdrawn}={remaining_balance_after_withdrawal}>>{remaining_balance_after_withdrawal}

She earns $90 in interest because {remaining_balance_after_withdrawal} x {second_year_interest_rate} = <<{remaining_balance_after_withdrawal}*{second_year_interest_rate}={second_year_interest_earned}>>{second_year_interest_earned}
